content.description: A gene that influences coat color in domestic cats is located on the <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> chromosome. A female cat that is heterozygous for the gene (<math alttext="X superscript B, X superscript O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></math>) has a calico-colored coat. In a genetics experiment, researchers mate a calico-colored female cat (<math alttext="X superscript B, X superscript O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>) with an orange-colored male cat (<math alttext="X superscript O, Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow></msup><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></math>) to produce an <math alttext="F 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>1</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> generation. The researchers record observations for the cats in the <math alttext="F 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>1</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> generation and plan to use the data to perform a chi-square goodness-of-fit test for a model of <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-linked inheritance. The data for the chi-square goodness-of-fit test are presented in Table 1.
content.question: Table 1. Data for the chi-square goodness-of-fit test Phenotype Genotype Observed Expected Calico-colored female <math alttext="X superscript B, X superscript O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> 15 10 Orange-colored female <math alttext="X superscript O, X superscript O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> 6 10 Black-colored male <math alttext="X superscript B, Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msup><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 11 10 Orange-colored male <math alttext="X superscript O, Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow></msup><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 8 10 The researchers calculate a chi-square value of 4.6 and choose a significance level of <math alttext="p equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements best completes the chi-square goodness-of-fit test?

choices.label: The null hypothesis can be rejected because the chi-square value is greater than the critical value.
The null hypothesis can be rejected because the chi-square value is less than the critical value.
The null hypothesis cannot be rejected because the chi-square value is greater than the critical value.
The null hypothesis cannot be rejected because the chi-square value is less than the critical value.

content.answer: The null hypothesis cannot be rejected because the chi-square value is less than the critical value.
